entry.title: Re: Error during creation of business partner from ARIBA...
entry.content:
Good day @Sudharmv 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Integrating SAP Ariba SLP with S/4HANA Public Cloud Using SAP Master Data Integration

Business Partner Integration, SAP Ariba Integration scenarios with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system

In summary, the error your encounter occurs when the Business Partner Function setup expected by Ariba SLP integration is not aligned with the public cloud partner determination configuration. Unlike Private Cloud or On-prem systems, in the public cloud, table-based partner determination is not accessible or customisable. All partner logic is handled through configuration apps and business roles under SSCUI and communication arrangements. The error indicates that Ariba is trying to post a supplier record with a partner function that is not yet active or mapped correctly in your integration scenario.

The public cloud clean-core provides compliant resolution steps.

Go to Communication Arrangements

--> search for SAP_COM_0053

Check that the arrangement is active and the communication user has Business Partner Integration authorisations.

Next, open Manage Your Solution app. Go to Configure Your Solution à Application Area: Sourcing and Procurement. Open the configuration step: Define Partner Determination Procedure for Supplier. Ensure that Partner Function VN is included in the active Partner Determination Procedure used by your Supplier Account Group.

Verify Account Group and Partner Schema Assignment. Make sure your supplier account group and purchasing document type both references the correct partner schema containing VN

Ensure that Ariba’s Supplier role SUPL maps to S4H role FLVN00 or FLVN01. The partner function VN must exist in the mapping.

Re-trigger the supplier replication from Ariba after corrections and monitor the status in Application Interface Framework. If the message shows green, then replication was successful.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Is the billing document type for return orders related to physical goods movement 'G2'?
entry.content:
Hi ALL,

In the billing document for a return order related to physical goods movement, the billing document type is designated as 'G2'.
Credit memos that are not related to physical goods movement are also set to 'G2' as the billing document type.
I don't understand why the return order and credit memo are both designated as 'G2' billing document type.
Could you please explain why this is set up this way?

Thank you.

entry.title: "Money" and "Date" format display according to "Locale" in Statements
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m looking for some clarification regarding how Money and Date formats are displayed in Compensation Statements.

Our template is configured as LocalCurrencyCentric, but for some currencies (for example, Hungary – Saudi Arabia), the locale-specific format doesn’t seem to appear correctly in the employee statement.

=> Does anyone know where to find the list of supported locales for Compensation Statements?

Additionally, in the Design Worksheet, our EffectiveDate field is defined as a DateTypeField using the formula below:

toDate(lookup('WTZ_effectivedate', cust_coun, 1), 'MM/dd/yyyy')

However, the displayed date format in the statement doesn’t seem to follow the employee’s locale.

=> Does anyone know which format is actually applied by the statement rendering engine?

Finally, is there any SAP table or mapping that links these elements?

  • Tool Language
  • Currency
  • Date Format
  • Money Format

Thanks in advance for your insights!

SAP SuccessFactors Compensation @xavierlegarrec

entry.title: Re: Transport the GL account with implementation status "...
entry.content:
Good day @charlene2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Chart of Accounts in S/4 HANA Public Cloud (Cloud ERP), Chart of Accounts, SAP Note 3332309

Transportation Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2408

To summarise, in public cloud, G/L accounts with implementation status Do Not Use are part fo SAP delivered content. These accounts exist in configuration templates (e.g., Replace Account Symbols, Substitute Account Symbols, Valuation Keys, etc.) but are not active and therefore not transported to test or production systems. The reason is, it enforces the clean core principle and protects you from accidentally transporting SAP-delivered configuration objects tied to inactive or obsolete G/L master data.

However, public cloud provides a clean core compliant resolution options. Let us go through one of those:

Go to Manage G/L Account Master Data

Identify the account and not its Do not Use status (Demo Screnshot has Statu= in process)

Instead of modifying SAP content, create a copy of the G/L account: (45050990 used in screenshot for reference purpose)

Maintain the same account group field status variant. Go to Manage your solution à Finance à Configuration Activity. Define Account Symbol Substitution. Replace the obsolete account with your active copy. This ensures a clean, transportable configuration aligned with the public cloud restrictions.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to Register Lot Items on Physical Inventory Count Sheets During Cycle Counting
entry.content:
Hi

 

When performing a cycle count using the Job Scheduling and Mass Processing - Physical Inventory App  only lot-managed items cannot be registered.

 

The following error occurs:

====================================================================

TG21 0000000003  with stock type 1 already exist(s)

Message no. M7702

Diagnosis

You have already included the specified stock in the physical inventory document.

System Response

The system can include a certain stock in a physical inventory document once only.

Procedure

Make sure your entries are correct.

If necessary, change the material number. the batch number or the stock type, or delete the superfluous item.

================================================================

I have never registered a physical inventory count slip for this item and this lot.

Yet I get a contradictory error. There's nothing I can do about it.

 

Is there a solution?

entry.title: Re: Need to update HSN code in PR/PO during creation from...
entry.content:
Good day @Sudharmv 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Integration with SAP Ariba, Treasury and Risk Management (TRM)

About integration to support the packaging information for handling units in ship notices from Ariba Network

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Connected with SAP Ariba Applications

To summarise, in public cloud, when you integrate SAP Ariba Guided Buying with public cloud procurement, the system supports the creation of Purchase Requisitions that can later be converted into purchase Orders through Automatic Purchase Order Creation app.

In regard to HSN/SAC (BR_NCM) not being available in the PR UI or payload from Ariba Guided Buying is expected in public cloud. The HSN Code is a localisation-specific field that is not mapped in the Ariba PR-to-S/4 payload because Guided Buying does not handle India tax classification fields directly. It is not introduced at PO item level under the India localisation tab.

In public cloud, the standard intergration flow follow: Ariba Guided Buying àPurchase Requisitions à Automatic Purchase Oder Creation. You cannot skip PR creation and create Pos directly from Ariba GB. That scenario is only available in AB and Invoicing integrated with On-Premise or Private Cloud systems.

You can consider a clean core solution option to maintain the HSN/SAC (BR-NCM) in the Material Master data under:

Manage Product Master data

Choose the product you want to maintain.

In View: choose India Localisation / Tax Data. Field: HSN Code (BR_NCM)

When the PR is converted into a PO, the system automatically derives BR_NCM from the material record into the PO India tab.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

reference attachment [Case],

--- Support Assistant ---
Users
Standard S-user ID

Q: Which S-user is having issue now?
A: PERSON_NAME.feng.pan.wg@fujifilm.com

Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How can I view [EVB7575663]
entry.content:
The logic for event notifications is that an S-user first needs to subscribe to the notifications for that product, and only then will they receive the relevant notifications. Since the occurrence time of this event is in August, subscribing to the product now will not allow you to receive notifications related to the event EVB7575663. Therefore, you can only view it in the availability tab via link https://me.sap.com/event/EVB7575663/overview after your S-user have full authorizations.

Thus please follow below steps : 

  1. At first, please contact your super/cloud admin to ask for relevant authorizations in the screenshot. You may click the "request authorization" button or search for your super/cloud admin in https://me.sap.com/userscontacts/impcont and send an email to them.
    Related KBA 2587408 - S-user ID authorizations for Cloud Availability and Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications (Get Notified) - SAP for Me 
  2.  However, considering that you may still need to check relevant event notifications in the future, I suggest you contact your super or Cloud admin to help you subscribe to the product's notifications.  
    Related KBA 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users - SAP for Me

entry.title: 资产会计 - 历史过账数据迁移 - 资产数量传输 - SAP ERP 公有云
entry.content:
在迁移资产数量时，为了更加准确的填写过账模版，可以将资产数量迁移分为三种情况，请根据实际业务需求进行调整： 

 

情况1：在会计年度末的资产数量传输 

 

○ 历史数据转移（LDT）日期：2024年12月31日 

○ 当前财年：2025年 

 

对于这种情况，用户需要填写STARTQUANTITY字段。系统会将资产起息日设置为2024年12月31日。请确保资本化日期在2024年12月31日之前。 

 

情况2：在会计年度期间的资产数量传输（迁移2025年及以前的数据） 

○ 历史数据转移（LDT）日期：2025年3月1日 

○ 当前财年：2025年 

在这里，用户需要填写STARTQUANTITY，系统将使用2025年1月1日作为资产起息日。资本化日期应早于2025年1月1日。

 

 

情况3：在会计年度期间的数量传输（针对2025年的数据） 

○ 历史数据转移（LDT）日期：2025年3月1日 

○ 当前财年：2025年 

在这种情况下，无需填写STARTQUANTITY。资本化日期可以是2025年的任何时间。用户需要同时完成表头和项目表。 

遵循这些指南应该有助于更有效地管理迁移过程并减少错误。

entry.title: Re: How to download WBS element or WBS element overview r...
entry.content:
Good day @erobaga 

 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and Project Control,   Project Control - Enterprise Projects, Project Financials Control

To summarise, in public cloud, there isn’t a single “WBS Element export” report like in on-premise because the public cloud version uses Fiori analytical apps instead of classical SAP GUI. However, there are several standard, clean-core compliant ways to export WBS elements to Excel. You do not need to use migration templates.

Let’s take a look at one of them

Search for Project Control-Enterprise Projects app.

In the overview, select the project you want to analyse.

Under the Structure tab, you can see all WBS elements associated with that project. Export to Spreadsheet. This will download all visible WBS elements, Project IDs, descriptions etc. to an Excel file. This is the recommended clean-core way to export WBS data.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud Notification User list for CDG
entry.content:
Hi karthikeyan,

Based on your description, I understand you would like to obtain a list of users who have enabled subscriptions for your cloud systems. If this is correct, you can view the user list via the Get Notified application by following these steps:

  1. Navigate to: https://me.sap.com/systemsprovisioning/getNotified
  2. Select "Manage Subscriptions"
  3. Ensure "By Subscription" is selected
  4. Navigate to and click on the cloud services you wish to verify, users who have subscribed to notifications will then be displayed.

For detailed information, please refer to 2548400 - Getting started with the SAP Cloud Availability - SAP for Me

If you have any further questions or require additional assistance, please do not hesitate to reach out. I am here to help.

Have a nice day !

Kind regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: how to adjust depreciation amount after complete transfer
entry.content:
How to adjust the depreciation amount so the monthly depreciation amount is the same after complete transfer?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: how to adjust depreciation amount after complete tran...
entry.content:
Hi Community,

The depreciation is calculated only as per the period control configuration corresponding to the type of transaction and the posting date of the transaction. For the complete transfer, as it's a daily depreciation based depreciation method, the depreciation is calculated from the date of posting of the complete transfer and not from the depreciation start date.

In order to manually adjust the amount, you may kindly refer to the help document below to check if there are any manual adjustment suitable for your business scenario. 

Help doc:<Manual posting in fixed asset>

 

Best Regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Mass reset and reversal function for Clearing documents
entry.content:
We have a scenario where in we need to reset and reverse multiple clearing documents.  Ex:  We need to cancel a payment document and reprocess the payment (if payment is rejected by the bank).  Then A/P team needs to cancel each tax tax entry first for each invoice in the payment and there is no option to do mass cancellation.  Team must reset and reverse each and every document manually one after other. 

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Mass reset and reversal function for Clearing documents
entry.content:
Use 'Reset Cleared items (FBRA)' app to reset the clearing documents identified in step1.  You can only reset one document.

This is in accordance with the standard system design

See kba 2682947  Mass reset in Fiori app Reset Cleared Items (App ID F2223)

To reverse Invoices created in FI See app Manage Journal Entries, for same mass reversal is possible.

entry.title: Add 'Net Due Interval 4' field in the 'Aging Grid of journal entry view of Account Receivables'
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Standard Fiori Application - Aging Grid of journal entry view of Account Receivables, have total 3 filters/parameters as 'Net Due Interval 1', 'Net Due Interval 2' and 'Net Due Interval 3'  which have default values as 30, 60 and 90 respectively.

Is it possible to add a new filter as a 'Net Due Interval 4' which will be having default value as 120 (editable)? (as shown in below screenshot)

My Observation - What I observed is, the existing fields 'Net Due Interval 1, 2 and 3 are coming from the underlying Interface CDS view - P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid1 . And by taking reference of 'Net Due Interval 1, 2 and 3', if we add the new field 'Net Due Interval 4' in this interface view by extending it then we have to add this field in all the other Interface Views and final consumption view also. Below are those standard cds views which needs to be extended to accommodate the new field 'Net Due Interval 4' - 

1) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid1 --> 1st Interface view to be extended 
2) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid2 
3) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid3 --> Here need to update the existing logic to calculate 'NetDueInterval' field with respect to 'Net Due Interval 4'
4) P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid4 --> Need to update the logic for fields 'Net Due Interval Amount 1, 2, 3 & 4' because 'NetDueInterval' (which is calculated in above cds view) is used in the calculation of those amount fields.
5) I_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid --> This is Cube View
6) C_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid --> This is Final Consumption view or Analytics Query View

Also I have observed that, the existing AR Aging report is giving correct result when I enter value 120 days in the 'Net Due Interval 3' for my requirement to calculate for 120 days interval.

Now, please guide -->

1) Is it possible to add 'Net Due Interval 4' field in the standard AR Aging Report?

2) If YES, then please validate my above observation i.e. we have to extend total 6 standard CDS views to add this new field.

3) In views 'P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid3' and 'P_ARJrnlEntrItmAgingGrid4' --> we have to update existing logic to calculate 'NetDueInterval' and 'Net Due Interval Amount 1, 2, 3 & 4' respectively. Is this is correct i.e. to update existing fields logic while doing CDS Extend?

4) If No, then shall we proceed by entering 120 days in 'Net Due Interval 3' which is giving us the correct the result?

Note - My system is S4HANA on Premise >> Release 2021 .

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Re: Timestamp to DATS (with user timezone) in Custom CDS...
entry.content:
Hi,

S/4 Public Cloud help page (08.2025) regarding Custom CDS View App mentions a limited list of functions which may give an incorrect idea of the app's capability.  I've come to realize that we can use all ABAP CDS functions for calculations. 

For calculating Date or Time from Timestamp (DEC 15), we can use the following:

Date: tstmp_to_dats( <timestamp>,  <timezone>, <client>, <on_error>)

Time: tstmp_to_tims( <timestamp>,  <timezone>, <client>, <on_error>)

We can use following values for timezone, client, on_error

Timezone: abap_system_timezone( $session.client, 'NULL' )

Clinet = $session.client

on_error = 'NULL' 

Thanks

entry.title: Re: Cloud Foundry Runtime in SAP BTP Trial shows 0 MB mem...
entry.content:
Hi,

Please check the link for similar issue

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/btp-cloud-foundry-consumed-by-all-spaces-exceeds-any-running-applications/qaq-p/14181547

Snippet from it.: Even though the application is stopped, tasks can still be running. We had to run command cf tasks APP-NAME for each app in the CF org. For one of the apps that was stopped, so we didn't think it would have been an issue, there were a series of tasks that were in status RUNNING and each task is consuming 1GB of memory. We're investigating why the task was not finishing successfully but we determined we can cancel the task. 

To cancel the task run command cf terminate-task APP-NAME TASK-ID. 

Afterwards, this cleared the memory consumption issue. 

Regards,

Prithviraj

entry.title: Re: How to Convert Thunderbird Files?
entry.content:
Hi @daisystanley 

Converting Thunderbird files is not simple for anyone. Thunderbird creates backups in MBOX and MSF formats. Both formats save the same number of files, but they don't run on all software, as most software supports the MBOX format. If you have a Thunderbird profile backup and want to import all Thunderbird backups to Outlook, then this task becomes tedious for anyone. In the AI world, there is much software available in the market to convert Thunderbird files. I suggest using the top Thunderbird converter to help you export Thunderbird files.

1. BLR Thunderbird Converter.
2. SysTools Thunderbird Backup Tool.
3. MacUncle Thunderbird Converter for Mac
4. CubexSoft MBOX Converter.

entry.title: Best Practices for Building a Marketplace App Using SAP Cloud Platform
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently exploring how to build a marketplace application (for products, services, or B2B solutions) using the SAP Cloud Platform, and I’d love to get insights from those who’ve worked on similar projects.

Specifically, I’m looking to understand:

  • Best practices for designing and developing a scalable marketplace on SAP Cloud Platform
  • How to effectively integrate SAP services (like SAP BTP, SAP Integration Suite, or SAP Fiori)
  • Recommended approaches for security, authentication, and user management
  • Tips for handling multi-vendor onboarding, payments, and product listings
  • Suggestions on performance optimization and maintaining smooth user experience
  • Any tools, frameworks, or extensions within SAP that make the development process easier

If you’ve built or contributed to a marketplace project on SAP, I’d really appreciate hearing about your lessons learned, challenges, and what worked best in your case.

Thanks in advance to anyone willing to share their experience or technical guidance!

entry.title: Master Blog: SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite Migration – Tool and Guidance
entry.content:
Migration Journey Overview: From Assessment to Tooling

Migrating from SAP Process Orchestration to the SAP Integration Suite represents a significant milestone in your organization’s cloud transformation journey. This master blog serves as a central hub for comprehensive information and guidance related to the Migration Tool and the broader migration process. It provides links to detailed blogs, documentation, and best practices to help you successfully plan and execute your migration to SAP Integration Suite.

Before beginning any migration activity, it’s crucial to start with the Migration Assessment - a key capability of the SAP Integration Suite. The assessment analyses your on-premises landscape, including existing integration configurations, mappings, custom adapters, and dependent objects. It provides detailed insights and a comprehensive overview indicating which scenarios can be migrated as-is, which ones require optimization, and which may need to be redesigned or modernized. This step establishes a clear, data-driven foundation for a successful and efficient migration journey.

Once your Migration Assessment is complete, the next big step is moving your integration content to the cloud - and that’s where the Migration Tool comes into play!

The Migration Tool, built into SAP Integration Suite’s Cloud Integration capability, helps you bring your existing integration scenarios from SAP Process Orchestration to the cloud with ease. Think of it as your Guided workflow for migration - it identifies what can be moved, converts integration artifacts into their cloud-ready counterparts, and helps you streamline the entire process with minimal manual effort.

Migration Tool – Offerings and Supported Components

The Migration Tool comes packed with a set of features to make your move from SAP Process Orchestration to the SAP Integration Suite smoother and faster. Here’s an overview of the key components it supports and automates.

Connectivity to On-Premise Systems: Choose the appropriate connection setup for securely linking your on-premise landscape with the SAP Integration Suite. For detailed configuration options, see Configuring Connectivity to an SAP Process Orchestration System

Object Types: The tool supports migration of integration artifacts such as Integrated Configurations, which define how messages are processed within the Java-only runtime of SAP Process Orchestration systems.

It also supports Receiver Determination, which is available in SAP Process Integration dual-stack installations (from release 7.5 onwards) where message processing takes place on both ABAP and Java stacks.

 

Patterns: The Migration Tool supports a variety of integration patterns to help you transition your existing scenarios to cloud-ready designs. These patterns provide flexibility for different integration needs - whether it’s point-to-point communication, content-based routing, or complex orchestration flows.

For the complete list of supported patterns, refer to the Migration Patterns

Migration Approaches: The Migration Tool offers two approaches - Standard Approach and Pipeline Approach to help you move your integration scenarios efficiently to the cloud. For more details, see Pipeline Concept

 

Communication Channels: The Migration Tool helps move your existing communication channels to the cloud, making sure your integration endpoints and related settings are mapped correctly. A few exceptions may apply, so some channels might need minor adjustments after migration. For more details, see Standard Adapter Migration.

Adapter Module Support: The tool automatically migrates PGP encryption and decryption modules to cloud-compatible configurations. Additional adapter modules are provided through the community package and can be leveraged as needed. The following list provides an overview: Adapter Modules

Decoupling and Ordered Message Processing with JMS Queues: The Migration Tool supports JMS queue configurations to enable decoupled communication between senders and receivers. In SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration, internal JMS Adapter help separate asynchronous message processing from the sender, allowing messages to be handled independently and reliably.

To ensure messages are processed in the correct order - EOIO, the Access Type should be set to Exclusive, which ensures that only one consumer/worker processes messages from the queue at a time.

Note: This configuration is not applied automatically by the Migration Tool and must be set manually.

Idempotent at Receiver: The tool also provides idempotent message handling at the receiver side. This means it helps prevent duplicate message processing, ensuring that each message is delivered and processed only once - an essential feature for maintaining data consistency.

Reusing Artifacts for Efficient Migration: The Migration Tool provides options for users to reuse existing standalone artifacts - message mappings and function libraries, to their migrated scenarios. This flexibility allows message mappings and other artifacts to be reused across multiple integration scenarios, reducing redundancy and speeding up the migration process.

Example: Enable Reusable Artifacts

 

Migration Summary: After the migration, a detailed summary report provides an overview of all successfully migrated Integration Flow Configurations and their related objects in the cloud. If any object could not be migrated, this information is clearly highlighted in the summary, helping you identify follow-up actions easily.

The Migration Tool does offer a downloadable Summary Report that captures essential migration details - including the on-premise system details, integration patterns used, chosen migration approach, and other key information related to each migrated object, which you can review later if required.

Note: If you’d like to select an alternative runtime profile instead of the default Cloud Integration, you can manually set it in the Integration Runtime configuration after the successful migration of the Integration Flow.

Error Logs: When the Migration Tool cannot migrate to certain integration scenarios, it generates a detailed error log summary. This log provides insights into the specific issues encountered, helping you understand what went wrong and take corrective actions.

Hint: The error log is available to download as a .csv file. You can import it in Excel and use a delimiter as Comma (,) to transform the data, to review and analyse the migration errors effectively check columns ‘Status’ and ‘Message’.

 

For detailed, step-by-step instructions on using the Migration Tool, refer to the official tutorial: Use the Migration Tooling

 

Known Limitations of the Migration Tool

While the Migration Tool covers a wide range of integration scenarios, there are some known gaps and limitations. For the most up-to-date information, refer to Known Limitations of Migration Tooling 

Disclaimer: The list of gaps and limitations may shorten as SAP expands coverage and implements features on its roadmap

 

Next in the Series

Stay tuned for the upcoming posts where we will dive deeper into specific migration scenarios, tips, and best practices to help you get the most out of SAP Integration Suite.

 

References - SAP Documentation and Blogs:

Migration Guide for SAP Process Orchestration

Get Started with Migration to SAP Integration Suite

Assessment Blog: How to use the Migration Assessment Application to get ready to migrate your SAP Process Orchestration Scenarios?

Migration Tool: Migration tool in Cloud Integration Capability of SAP Integration Suite

But while creating a new Instance, I could not select the described "Event Mesh Message Client" described in the help page.

So I could not proceed.

While talking with other consultants, they suggested adding a new service plan in the entitlements:

  • Service: SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh 
  • Service technical name: event-mesh-message-client

After this assignment, I could select the service "SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh" during Instance creation (but not the mentioned "Event Mesh Message Client" service from the help page)
Finally, the instance creation failed with an error (see screenshot):
Error: Couldn't create an instance of service 'SAP Integration Suite, Event Mesh' with plan 'message-client'. Service broker error: Service broker event-mesh-message-client-service-broker-live failed with: Request body is invalid 

Entitlement:

Any idea what to do?

Thanks, Bruno

entry.title: Archiving Write Job for /OPT/DOC Object Taking Too Long
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I’m working on the OpenText VIM solution integrated with SAP, and I’m facing a performance issue during the /OPT/DOC archiving write job (program: /OPT/ARC_DP_WRITE).

The job is taking around 8–9 hours to process ~40,000 records. After running a performance trace, I observed that about 99.7% of the runtime is consumed on the database, mainly on the table /OPT/VIM_8LOG.

Here are the details:

Table: /OPT/VIM_8LOG
Total Record Count: ~3,540,616
Archiving Period: 1 month
Observation: The trace shows a full table scan on /OPT/VIM_8LOG using `BUS_OBJKEY` (and `MANDT`) to link with the header table `/OPT/VIM_1HEAD`.

It looks like the system is performing a nested loop and clustered table access, causing significant delays.

My questions are:

1. Would creating a secondary index on (MANDT, BUS_OBJKEY) be advisable to improve performance?
2. Has anyone faced a similar issue with /OPT/VIM_8LOG during archiving?


Any guidance or best practices for optimizing this write job would be really helpful.

Thanks,
Snehankita

entry.title: Re: Generate PDF form on S/4HANA Cloud, public edition fr...
entry.content:
Hey @daa,

It is not an authorization issue but rather specific requirement for the OData service consumption, so basically Output Control framework is OData V2 and in that specfic case SAML authentication must be used. That means it is not just one GET request but chain of request to authenticate you.
I would suggest you to use https://github.com/SAP/odata-library to operate with service I mentioned based on the already implemneted logic. Code would be something like:

const pdfStream = await service.odata.readPdfFromDirectUrl("<system>/sap/opu/odata/sap/CA_OC_OUTPUT_REQUEST_SRV/Items(ApplObjectType='TM_FREIGHTORDER',ApplObjectId='00000000006600000978',ItemId='3')/Preview/$value/", <username>, <password>, true);

That method do everything: initialize Odata service with SAML, retrieve the PDF form and then return it back.

Note: I used TM output control, but in your case it could be the different application and item numbering.

Best Regards,
Slava Aliakseyevets

entry.title: Seeking Guidance on Configuring Access for Vendor Transactions in S4HANA Public Cloud System
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We have four users with specific roles and restrictions:

User A:
- Can post entries for a specific vendor.
- Needs access to all postings and reports related to that vendor.

User B:
- No access to any data related to the vendor managed by User A.

User C:
- Can make payments for all vendors except the one managed by User A.
- Vendor managed by User A should not be visible in any payment applications.

User 😧
- Can make payments only for the vendor managed by User A.

Applications in use include:
- Maintain Business Partner
- Create Supplier Invoice Advance
- Manage Supplier Line Item
- Display Supplier Balance
- Manage Automatic Payment
- Display Journal Entries (with respect to vendor)
- Supplier Down Payment
- Post Outgoing Payment

Could you please suggest ways to configure these settings and meet the requirements?

entry.title: Text Object cannot move to X=0 or Y=0 with Snap to Grid enabled — behavior depends on Zoom Level
entry.content:
Product and Version:
    Product: SAP Crystal Reports 2016
    Version: Support Pack 9 Patch 21 (v14.2.9.5104)

Environment Settings:
   Snap to Grid: Checked
   Grid Size: 0.160 cm

Issue Description:
When moving a Text Object using the keyboard arrow keys, it cannot be positioned exactly at X = 0 or Y = 0 under certain Zoom  Levels, even though Snap to Grid is enabled.
This behavior changes depending on the current zoom setting.

Steps to Reproduce:
   Open a report in the Design view.
   Enable Snap to Grid and set Grid Size to 0.160 cm.
   Select a Text Object.
   Use the arrow keys to move it to the far left or top edge of the design area.
   Repeat at different Zoom Levels (100% to 200%).

Observed Behavior:
   The ability to move the object to X=0 or Y=0 changes with zoom level:
   Zoom Level Can move to X=0/Y=0?
     100 % : Yes
     110 % : No
     120 % : Yes
     130 % : No
     140 % : Yes
     150 % : Yes
     160 % : No
     170 % : Yes
     180 % : No
     190 % : Yes
     200 % : Yes

Expected Behavior:
   Regardless of the Zoom Level, the Text Object should be able to align exactly to X=0 or Y=0 when Snap to Grid is enabled.

Question:
   Is this a known issue or limitation?
   If so, is there any fix, patch, or recommended workaround to ensure consistent snapping behavior across all zoom levels?

entry.title: SAP PI/PO Move如何帮助用户迁移到集成套件概况介绍
entry.content:
如果您对BTP感兴趣，BTP个人精选内容目录 | SAP Blogs 可能有更多你需要的内容

 

您的SAP PI/PO系统还能"撑"多久？

 

如果您还在使用本地部署的SAP PI或PO进行系统集成，是否已经感受到维护成本越来越高、技术支持即将到期的压力？当业务部门要求快速对接新系统时，您的团队是否还需要数周甚至数月才能完成？更关键的是，NetWeaver 7.5等版本的维护支持即将结束，您准备好应对技术风险了吗？

SAP PI/PO Move不只是一次简单的系统迁移，而是您摆脱技术债务、拥抱云原生集成能力的战略机遇——让集成从"重负担"变为"新引擎"。

 

 

PI/PO Move是什么？

SAP PI/PO Move是一套流程，指从本地部署的SAP Process Integration (PI) 或 SAP Process Orchestration (PO) 系统迁移到云端SAP集成套件的全套转型流程，涵盖了从传统中间件平台向云原生集成平台的全面转换

 

 

SAP设计PI/PO Move流程的目的是什么？

战略层面

通过一站式的现代化集成平台承接所有集成需求，降低客户的技术债务和维护成本

为数字化转型提供现代化的集成基础设施支撑，尤其是在拥抱新技术上

功能层面

没有PI/PO Move时：

  • 维护成本高昂：本地PI/PO系统需要专门的硬件、软件许可和技术人员维护 [4]
  • 技术栈老化：NetWeaver 7.5等版本即将结束维护支持，存在技术风险
  • 扩展性限制：本地部署难以快速响应业务增长和集成需求变化

完成PI/PO Move后：

  • 降低总体拥有成本：云端托管减少基础设施投资和运维开销
  • 获得持续创新：自动获取最新功能更新和安全补丁
  • 提升集成敏捷性：利用预构建连接器和API加速集成开发

 

 

PI/PO Move使用到了哪些组件，详细流程如何，可以达成什么价值？

SAP针对PI/PO Move的流程设计了全套工具：

  • 集成套件：新一代集成平台，将承接并扩展PI/PO集成能力
  • 集成套件内置的迁移评估工具：通过对接PI/PO测试系统，来自动化分析当前集成内容，哪些可以一键迁移至集成套件，哪些需要简要修改，哪些需要大量修改，并给出分析报表
  • 集成套件内置的迁移执行工具：通过对接PI/PO测试系统，选择有信心的PI/PO集成内容，一键转换为集成套件需要的格式，并存储进集成套件
  • 预定义内容：针对特定集成场景设计，免费下载后只需填入基本的连接，安全信息即可部署

这些工具和能力协同工作，帮助用户完成以下流程：

  • 发现阶段：了解Integration Suite能力，定义集成原则和策略；通过集成套件内置的迁移评估工具评估现有PI/PO系统；
  • 准备阶段：分析评估报表，分析迁移工作量和自动迁移可能性
  • 探索阶段：进行变更影响分析，构建业务案例，制定详细迁移计划
  • 实现阶段：组合迁移执行能力和手动迁移方式完成最终迁移，配置新系统，进行测试验证
  • 部署阶段：渐进式的将接口切换到Integration Suite，确保业务连续性
  • 运行阶段：持续优化和风险管理，跟进最新技术创新，例如事件驱动，API管理等

 

 

关于本文内容有任何问题或见解，欢迎在评论区留下你的想法

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition(GROW) scope item; pr...
entry.content: Public cloud 3F0 event-based production costing as of now does not support CO production order (04), but only production order (10), process order (40) and product cost collectors (05). We are currently in the requirement collection phase of CO production order, could you please leave your email that we could talk in call on the customer's business needes for CO production order?
